poem:
The Ship We Steer

The night hums with laughter,  
yet beneath, a stern tide swells—  
cries muffled on the breeze,  

as the captain, with shadowed eyes,  
charts a course through whispered warnings.

We hold the rails,  
gazing past horizons,  
where dreams tremble  
against authority's grip.  

The waves wear thin,  
beyond the mocking light.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Stephen Colbert: ‘We’re not on our way to a dictatorship, we’re on the ship’ Late-night hosts looked at Donald Trump’s recent dictatorial behaviour, including his attempt to bully Harvard University into following his demands. Related: Jon Stewart on Trump: ‘I did not think that he would get this authoritarian this fast’ Stephen Colbert On The Late Show, Stephen Colbert spoke about the alleged “administrative error” that saw Kilmar Ábrego García snatched off the streets by". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
